mng: mouth, classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc), classifier for bites or mouthfuls

exm.mng: window, opening providing restricted access (e.g. customer service window), computer operating system window, fig. medium, intermediary, showpiece, testing ground
an exit, to speak, to export, (of a ship) to leave port
Yamaguchi (Japanese surname and place name), Yamaguchi prefecture in southwest of Japan's main island Honshū 本州[Ben3 zhou1]
(of two performers) to speak or sing alternately, to be fit for the purposes of a job or task, (of food) to suit sb's taste
incision, notch, slit, gash, margin of a page, trimmed edge (of a page in a book)
slang, argot, private language used as secret code
to use as an excuse, on the pretext, excuse, pretext, also written 借口[jie4 kou3]
